instruction: Please analyze the UFC Fighters’ Statistics 2024 dataset to find the top fighters in each weight class and count how many of them have never been defeated. Enter the results into `undefeated.csv`.
name: dm-csv-001

instruction: Tell me how many of these students have been married before and how many have never been married, fill the corresponding answers into the appropriate places in result.csv.
name: dm-csv-002

instruction: From the  dataset, find and list the top five most frequent educational qualifications for both mothers and fathers. Calculate the frequency for each qualification, sort them in descending order, and save the results in `top_qualifications.csv`. Ensure the file includes columns: “Mother’s Qualification”, “Mother’s Frequency”, “Father’s Qualification”, and “Father’s Frequency”.
name: dm-csv-003

instruction: Conduct an analysis to determine the total number of Games held for both the Summer and Winter Olympics. Record this information in "allGames.csv" following the template in "sample_allGames.csv". Additionally, for each edition of both the Summer and Winter Olympics, identify the host city and the total number of events conducted, and compile this detailed information in "allEvents.csv" following the template in "sample_allEvents.csv".
name: dm-csv-004

instruction: Based on the instructions in age.txt, count the number of people in each age group and record the results in result.csv following the template provided in sample_result.csv. Note that if there are any missing values in the Age column, you need to fill them with 30.
name: dm-csv-005

instruction: Determine which products are frequently purchased together. Specifically, find the different products that are purchased together in the same order and calculate the number of times they are purchased together. Following the format of sample_result.csv, write the information of the top two pairs with the highest purchase count into result.csv. The column names in result.csv should be “product_a” for the name of the first product in the pair, “product_b” for the name of the second product in the pair, and “co_purchase_count” for the number of times the two products are purchased together.
name: dm-csv-006

instruction: Calculate the top 10 most popular movies by considering only those whose number of votes falls within the top 15%. Use the formula described in "wrFormula.tex" for this calculation. After completing the calculations, write the names of the resulting movies line by line into "result.txt".
name: dm-csv-007

instruction: Calculate the correlation coefficient between leverage_ratio and profitability_ratio. Then, based on the value of the correlation coefficient, determine whether the relationship is positive, negative, or no correlation.
name: dm-csv-008

instruction: Identify the top 10 best-rated authors, the most expensive authors, and the authors with the most ratings, save results to 'author.csv' following the template provided in'sample_result.csv'.
name: dm-csv-009

instruction: Calculate the monthly average sales volume for each bike category and write the results into 'avg_units_sold.csv' following the template of 'sample_result.csv'.
name: dm-csv-010

instruction: Calculate the total quantity sold and total sales revenue for each bike type from 2016 to 2018, write the results into 'result.csv' following the template of 'sample_result.csv'.
name: dm-csv-011

instruction: You need to assist in selecting the names of the top five users ranked by total expenditure along with their corresponding total expenditure, and then write the results into result.csv following the template of sample_result.csv.
name: dm-csv-012

instruction: Determine the club with the best average physicality from the top 20 clubs with the highest average scores in FIFA 20. Based on BMI.txt, find the top scorer of the chosen club. Record the name of the club and the player's full name in result.csv, following the template provided in sample_result.csv.
name: dm-csv-013

instruction: Calculate each review's score using the formula in Wilson.tex, then extract summaries of the top 3 reviews. Write the results into result.csv following the template in sample_result.csv.
name: dm-csv-014

instruction: I need you to go through the baseball dataset and identify the top player in terms of games played, runs scored, hits, and home runs. Make sure to save this information in a file named 'result.csv' following the template of `sample_result.csv`.
name: dm-csv-015

instruction: As we look to analyze our football match data, I need your team to compile season statistics for both Italian Serie A (IT1) and the Bundesliga (BESC). Focus on identifying the top-performing clubs in terms of wins for each season. Once you've gathered this information, summarize the results in a CSV file named result.csv following the format of sample_result.csv
name: dm-csv-016

instruction: You need to follow guidance from data_standard.md to calculate the Net Promoter Score (NPS) for a dataset and write the results in the format specified by result.csv.
name: dm-csv-017

instruction: Please review the Data Science Programs list dataset to determine the top 10 universities with the most affordable data science programs. Record their tuition fees and save the results in `result.csv`, ensuring they are sorted by fees from lowest to highest and formatted according to `sample_result.csv`.
name: dm-csv-018

instruction: Analyze the dataset to identify the top 20 teams based on average score and record their number of draws. Arrange the results in `result.csv`, sorting by the number of draws from highest to lowest, and follow the format outlined in `sample_result.csv`.
name: dm-csv-019

instruction: Please review the Telco customer churn dataset to determine the top 10 cities with the highest churn rates. Save the findings in `result.csv`, formatted according to the template in `sample_result.csv`.
name: dm-csv-020

instruction: You need to identify the top 3 most popular product categories among families with 0, 1, and 2 children, and write the results into result.csv following the template of sample_result.csv.
name: dm-csv-021

instruction: Assuming the current year is 2024, you need to calculate the Mean Campaign Acceptance Rate by Age for each country according to the year ranges specified in result.csv, and fill in the results in result.csv.
name: dm-csv-022

instruction: You need to calculate the average number of campaigns it takes for customers with each education level to receive their first offer, and write the results into average_campaign_accepted_by_education.csv following the template of sample_result.csv.
name: dm-csv-023

instruction: Following the instructions in tips.txt, you need to calculate the total number of online purchases and in-store purchases for different income groups, and fill in the results in purchase_by_income.csv. The template for purchase_by_income.csv has been provided.
name: dm-csv-024

instruction: Enhance the existing code in analys.py to calculate winning and losing probabilities for each team as outlined in tips.txt. Determine the team with the highest winning probability and the team with the highest losing probability. Record their names and corresponding probabilities in team_probabilities.csv, adhering to the format in sample_result.csv.
name: dm-csv-025

instruction: Finish the analysis.py script to rank players in FIFA 22 based on the specified score for each position from 2015 to 2022. Refer to the provided text and Markdown files for guidance. Write the results in result.csv, following the template in sample_result.csv.
name: dm-csv-026

instruction: identify the top 10 countries by the number of produced shows and their corresponding counts, as well as the top 10 movie genres by the number of occurrences and their corresponding counts. Record the results in the provided templates: Top_10_countries.csv and Top_10_Movies.csv.
name: dm-csv-027

instruction: calculate the total profit for each state by subtracting cost from revenue, sort the profits in descending order, and write the results into the state_profit.csv file using the provided template.
name: dm-csv-028

instruction: identify the top 3 users with the most pull requests and record their usernames and the number of pull requests in the top3_pull_requests.csv file using the provided template.
name: dm-csv-029

instruction: identify the latest 10 pull requests, merge the related file data, and find the unique files involved in these pull requests. Record the results in the unique_files.csv file using the sample_result.csv template.
name: dm-csv-030

instruction: identify the users who made the last 6 pull requests for the specific file "src/compiler/scala/reflect/reify/phases/Calculate.scala". Record the results in the users_last_6.csv file using the provided template.
name: dm-csv-031

instruction: calculate the proportion of 1-day retention being True for the gate_30 and gate_40 versions, respectively. Record the results in the retention_by_version.csv file using the provided template.
name: dm-csv-032

instruction: compare the 1-day retention rates between two versions of a game (gate_30 and gate_40) according to the instructions in guidance.txt. Calculate the probability (expressed as a decimal) that the retention rate is higher for gate_30 and record the result in the probability_greater_retention.csv file using the provided template.
name: dm-csv-033

instruction: calculate the proportion of 7-day retention being True for the gate_30 and gate_40 versions, respectively. Record the results in the retention_7_by_version.csv file using the provided template.
name: dm-csv-034

instruction: convert all time columns to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and record each user’s pulled files based on their pid. If a user pulled multiple files within one pid, you need to record these files separately. Write the results in the output.csv file using the format provided in sample_output.csv.
name: dm-csv-035

instruction: identify the last six users who made pull requests for `src/compiler/scala/reflect/reify/phases/Calculate.scala`. and fill in their usernames in the template file users_last_6.csv.
name: dm-csv-036

instruction: identify the top three users who made the most pull requests for `src/compiler/scala/reflect/reify/phases/Calculate.scala` and fill in their usernames in the template file top_3_developers.csv.
name: dm-csv-037

instruction: I want to know the number of pull requests made by two users with the nicknames “soc” and “xeno-by” for each year between 2011 and 2016. Please fill in your statistical results in the provided template file pull_requests_by_year_and_author.csv.
name: dm-csv-038

instruction: conduct a supply chain analysis of three ingredients used in an avocado toast according to the instructions in tips.md, utilizing the Open Food Facts database. Identify the list of ingredients and their countries of origin, and record the results in the ingredient_origins.csv file using the provided template.
name: dm-csv-039

instruction: Categorize the salary scale into four levels according to the salaries of all employees. For the company size with the most top-level employees, determine the designations and salaries of the top 10 paid employees. Save the results in result.csv, following the format in sample_result.csv.
name: dm-csv-040

instruction: You need to count the stop outcomes for female and male drivers when they are pulled over for speeding, and express them as proportions. Save the results to the stop_outcomes_by_gender.csv file using the provided template.
name: dm-csv-041

instruction: Your objective is to calculate the total number of days between the Invoice date and the Cohort date for each entry in the dataset. Save this calculated difference as CohortIndex in the result.csv file.
name: dm-csv-042

instruction: Calculate the retention data of each cohort, and save the results to 'retension.csv'.
name: dm-csv-043

instruction: Calculate the average unit price paid for items by groups of customers over time, where each group is based on the month of their first purchase. Save the results to 'average_price.csv', utilizing the provided template file.
name: dm-csv-044

instruction: According to the information in tips.txt, you need to use the RFM method to calculate values for each CustomerID in the datasmart.csv for the recent 12 months. Save the results in datasmart.csv.
name: dm-csv-045

instruction: Calculate the annualized volatility and annualized variance of Microsoft trading data. Fill in the calculated results in result.csv according to the template provided in sample_result.csv.
name: dm-csv-046

instruction: Calculate the historical beta of FamaFrenchData using the Capital Asset Pricing Model (CAPM). Write the calculated results into result.csv, with the column named “result”.
name: dm-csv-047

instruction: Your task is to calculate the drawdown of USO, an ETF that tracks oil prices. Fill in the results into result.csv, as provided in the corresponding file.
name: dm-csv-048

instruction:
Use the mean to fill in missing values, then calculate the correlation between Population Density and Life Expectancy, and between Population Density and GDP. Please output the answers below in JSON format by filling in the placeholders in:

"""
{
  "Correlation between Population Density and Life Expectancy": [...],
  "Correlation between Population Density and GDP": [...]
}
"""
name: dm-csv-049

instruction: Using 2017 stock return datasets for 9 biggest companies, calculate the cumulative returns of three different portfolio strategies(default portfolio, equal-weight portfolio, and market value-weighted portfolio), and save the results in result.csv.
name: dm-csv-050

instruction: Calculate the portfolio volatility of the default portfolio and provide the answer in percentage. Write the result into output.csv, with the column named “result”.
name: dm-csv-051

instruction: Calculate RFM_Score for each customer, build segmentation and define the level, then assign it to each customer, save the result to 'result.csv'.
name: dm-csv-052

instruction: Use a 1-3 scale to calculate the RFM Score. For each CustomerID in RFM_Score.csv, calculate the corresponding user’s RFM score and fill in the results in RFM_Score.csv (the file format has been provided; please fill in the results accordingly).
name: dm-csv-053

instruction: Calculate the Sharpe Ratio for each asset, and find the minimum and maximum values of the Sharpe ratios. Write the results into result.csv according to the format provided in sample_result.csv.
name: dm-csv-054

instruction: Calculate the cumulative returns of the portfolio (“Portfolio”) and the excess returns over the risk-free rate (“Portfolio_Excess”) of FamaFrenchData over time. After calculating, ensure to fill in your results into result.csv. Please note that the Date column data in result.csv has already been provided.
name: dm-csv-055

instruction: Please use the Portfolio Risk Management dataset to select the equal-weighted portfolio and calculate its historical beta with the Fama-French data. Save your findings in `result.csv`, ensuring they follow the format provided in `sample_result.csv`.
name: dm-csv-056

instruction: Calculate a set of summary statistics about the purchase data, broken out by ‘device’ (Android or iOS) and ‘gender’ (Male or Female). Fill the corresponding blanks in purchase_summary.csv with these summary statistics.
name: dm-csv-057

instruction: Calculate and print the confidence interval for the difference in conversion rates (lift) between a test group and a control group. Write the results into result.csv according to the format provided in sample_result.csv.
name: dm-csv-058

instruction: Analyze the purchasing behavior of users within the first week of their registration date. Calculate the average number of purchases made in the first week on a daily basis, and then fill the results into result.csv.
name: dm-csv-059

instruction: Calculate the average daily purchases and paywall views for the entire population. Write the results into result.csv according to the format provided in sample_result.csv.
name: dm-csv-060

instruction: Calculate the dates of the earliest and most recent reviews, the numbers of private rooms, and the average listing price. Fill in the results into result.csv according to the template provided in result.csv.
name: dm-csv-061

instruction: Analyze the handwashing history dataset to determine the average monthly reduction in the proportion of deaths after handwashing began on June 1, 1847. Record your findings in `result.csv`, formatted as required.
name: dm-csv-062

instruction: Find the oldest business on each continent and fill in the relevant information into result.csv according to the fomat specified in result.csv.
name: dm-csv-063

name: dm-csv-064

instruction:
Using the formula from tips.md, calculate Algeria's World Population Percentage for 2030, 2040, and 2050, starting from the year 2022. Please output the answers below in JSON format by filling in the placeholders in:
